topic.title: Chapter 2
topic.shortdesc: Cinderella mourns her mother and new life with her step-family, while her father journeys to the fair and returns with gifts.

section.title: Cinderellas Father Departs
section.p:
The father one day left to go to the fair and asked the two step-sisters and Cinderella what they would like for him to bring back.
One step-sister asked for pearls and jewels.
The other step-sister wished for beautiful dresses.
Cinderella asked Father, break off for me the first branch which knocks against your hat on your way home.

section.title: Gifts From The Fair
section.p: The father went to the fair and brought back pearls and jewels for one step-sister, beautiful dresses for the other step-sister, and the first branch of a hazel-bush that knocked off his hat on the journey home for Cinderella. Cinderella thanked him, and then buried the branch by her mothers grave, weeping over it every day, her tears falling down to water it.

section.title: Morning And The Little White Bird
section.p: The tree grew strong, with Cinderella visiting the grave every day. A little white bird perched on the tree. When Cinderella wished for something, the bird threw down what she had wised for.
